Metadata.title: When Does Rainbow Six Siege Season End? | R6 Live Countdown
Metadata.description: Live countdown to the end of Rainbow Six Siege Operation Tenfold Pursuit (Y10S4). Track the exact season end date and Year 11 Season 1 release time.

Article.title: Operation Tenfold Pursuit: Complete Season Guide
Article.completion_desc:
Rainbow Six Siege Operation Tenfold Pursuit (Year 10 Season 4) is scheduled to conclude on March 3, 2026. This date follows Ubisoft's standard quarterly release cycle, which typically lasts around 90 days.

The transition to Year 11 Season 1 will begin with a scheduled maintenance period, usually starting at 09:00 AM ET (14:00 UTC). During this downtime, ranked matchmaking will be disabled for approximately 60 to 90 minutes while the servers are updated. Players should ensure they complete their final ranked matches at least 30 minutes before the cutoff to avoid abandon penalties.
Article.next_desc:
As the season ends, your final rank will determine the rewards you receive, including the seasonal charm, Alpha Packs, and background cards.

Rank Reset Explained: At the start of Y11S1, every player's visual rank will reset to Copper V. However, your hidden Matchmaking Rating (MMR) does not fully reset. This 'Skill Rating' persists and helps the system match you against players of similar skill level during your placement matches. This mechanic ensures that Champion-level players do not get matched against true Copper players during the first week of the new season.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.q1: When does the current Rainbow Six Siege season end?
FAQ.a1: Rainbow Six Siege Operation Tenfold Pursuit (Year 10 Season 4) is targeted to end on March 3, 2026. This date is based on the in-game Battle Pass timer and Ubisoft's historical release patterns for Year 10. Dates may shift by 24-48 hours depending on technical stability and last-minute delays.
FAQ.q2: What happens to my Rank and MMR?
FAQ.a2: When Y11S1 launches, your visual rank resets to Copper V. However, your hidden MMR (Skill Rating) carries over. If you finished High Platinum or Diamond, you will gain significantly more RP (Rank Points) per win at the start of the next season, allowing you to return to your 'true rank' faster. This is known as 'RP Gain/Loss Disparity'.
FAQ.q3: Do Battle Pass tokens carry over?
FAQ.a3: No. Battle Pass tokens do not carry over to the next season. You must spend all your earned tokens on Battle Pass rewards before the timer hits zero. Any unspent tokens will disappear. However, unused Bravo Tickets typically remain in your inventory.
FAQ.a4: Yes. Your cosmetics, renown, credits, and operators are shared across all platforms (PC, Xbox, PlayStation) as long as your accounts are linked to the same Ubisoft Connect ID. However, rank progression is separate between PC and Console pools.

NextSeason.title: What We Know About Year 11 Season 1

About.meta_description: Learn about the mission behind R6 Countdown and how we track Rainbow Six Siege seasons.
About.title: About R6 Countdown
About.p1: R6 Countdown is a community-driven project dedicated to providing the most accurate and up-to-date countdown timers for Rainbow Six Siege seasonal updates.
About.p2: We understand the frustration of timezone conversions and unclear release schedules. Our mission is to simplify this for players worldwide.
About.mission_desc: To be the #1 reliable source for Siege timing intelligence, helping players maximize their Battle Pass progression and rank grinding.

Contact.meta_description: Get in touch with the R6 Countdown team for feedback or inquiries.
Contact.title: Contact Us
Contact.subtitle: Have a suggestion, found a bug, or just want to say hello? We'd love to hear from you.
Contact.disclaimer: This website is not affiliated with, endorsed, sponsored, or specifically approved by Ubisoft Entertainment. Rainbow Six Siege is a registered trademark of Ubisoft.

Updates.meta_title: R6 Siege Y10S4 Balance Changes & Y11S1 Leaks | Update Notes
Updates.meta_description: Exclusive coverage of Rainbow Six Siege Year 10 Season 4 operator balances, including Solis nerfs, Striker buffs, and latest Year 11 Season 1 leaks.
Updates.title: Season Updates & Intelligence
Updates.section_1_desc: The mid-season reinforcement patch brings critical adjustments to the defender meta. Ubisoft focuses on reducing the roaming efficiency of Solis while boosting Striker's utility to make him a viable alternative to Zofia.
Updates.solis_change_2: Cannot use P90 while scanning (must unequip).
Updates.section_2_desc: Initial reports suggest Year 11 will launch with a heavy rework of Consulate and a new Greek operator codenamed 'Hoplite' who deploys a phalanx shield.
Updates.rumor_alert_desc: Subject to change. Data mined from Test Server build 89402.
